The Doctor sits immediately to the right of the Teacher. The Engineer is at the right end. The Artist sits to the left of the Lawyer, but not immediately. The Manager is next to the Engineer. Who is the Accountant?

A) The person at the left end
B) The person 2nd from the right
C) The person 2nd from the left
D) The person 4th from the left
choices: A) The person at the left end
B) The person 2nd from the right
C) The person 2nd from the left
D) The person 4th from the left
explanation: Engineer is right end, Manager next to him. Lawyer is 3rd from left. Artist is to the left of lawyer but not immediately. Doctor is right of Teacher. Accountant is only remaining option for the left end.

question: Seven people - P, Q, R, S, T, U, and V - are sitting in a straight line facing North. P sits at one end. S sits third to the right of P. Q sits to the immediate left of V. U sits to the immediate right of T. R sits at the other end. Only two people sit between S and U. Who sits at the extreme left?
explanation: P at one end, S 3rd right of P. Two between S and U. R at the other end. Q left of V and T left of U fit only one arrangement: P _ _ S _ U T. Therefore, P is at the extreme left.

question: Six friends – A, B, C, D, E, and F – are sitting around a circular table facing the center. A is to the immediate left of D. B sits opposite C. E is not adjacent to D. F is to the immediate right of B. Who sits opposite A? (Circular Arrangement)
explanation: A is opposite to B. C is to A's left, D is opposite to C. E is not adjacent to D. F is to the immediate right of B. Only F remains to sit opposite A.

question: Seven professionals – a Doctor, Engineer, Lawyer, Teacher, Manager, Accountant, and Artist – are seated in a row. The Lawyer sits at the extreme right. The Doctor is next to the Teacher. The Engineer is to the left of the Manager. The Accountant is at the extreme left. The Artist is between the Engineer and the Lawyer. Who is sitting in the middle? (Linear Arrangement)
explanation: Accountant is leftmost, Lawyer rightmost, Doctor and Teacher are adjacent. Engineer, Artist, Lawyer are together. This positions Manager in the middle. All constraints satisfied.

question: Six friends (A, B, C, D, E, F) are sitting around a circular table facing the center. A is next to D and F. B is opposite F. C is not next to D. Who is sitting opposite to A? (Circular Arrangement)
explanation: A is between D and F, B is opposite F. C is not next to D so C must occupy the seat opposite A.

question: Seven professionals (Engineer, Doctor, Lawyer, Teacher, Manager, Accountant, Artist) sit in a row. The Lawyer is at the left end. The Teacher is third from the right. The Engineer is next to the Lawyer. The Doctor is next to the Teacher. The Manager is next to the Engineer. Who is at the right end?
explanation: Lawyer is left end, Engineer next, Manager next. Teacher is 3rd from right, Doctor adjacent. That leaves Artist at the right end.

question: Six friends (A, B, C, D, E, F) of different nationalities are sitting around a circular table facing the center. The Italian is to the right of A. B is opposite the Chinese. The Japanese is between C and D. E is not adjacent to A. F is Brazilian. The Chinese is next to the Brazilian. Who is opposite the Italian? (Circular Arrangement)
explanation: By placing A, Brazilian, Chinese, Japanese, and applying adjacency constraints, E ends up opposite the Italian.

question: Seven professionals (P, Q, R, S, T, U, V) are seated in a straight line. A doctor is 3rd from the left. P is an engineer at the right end. Q, a lawyer, is to the immediate left of P. R is a teacher and sits next to the doctor. S is an accountant. U sits between R and Q. V is a manager. Who is sitting at the extreme left?
explanation: Positions deduced: T (left end), Doctor, R, U, Q, P (Engineer), leaving S and V in remaining spots but T is at the leftmost.

question: Six friends - A, B, C, D, E, and F - are sitting around a circular table facing the center. A is between B and C. F is opposite A. D is not next to C. E is next to B. Who is sitting opposite to B?
explanation: A between B and C, F opposite A, E next to B, leaving D opposite B.

question: Seven people (P, Q, R, S, T, U, V) are sitting in a straight line facing north. P sits third from the left. R sits immediately to the right of P. S is at the right end. Q sits to the immediate left of S. U sits to the left of P. V is not next to S. Who sits at the extreme left end?
explanation: P third from left, U left of P, R right of P, Q then S on right end, so T is the only one at the left end.

question: Six professionals – a Doctor, Engineer, Lawyer, Teacher, Manager, and Accountant – sit in a row facing north. The Lawyer sits 2nd from the left. The Engineer sits at the right end. The Teacher is next to the Lawyer. The Doctor sits next to the Engineer. The Manager is not next to the Teacher. Who is the Accountant?
explanation: Engineer is at position 6. Doctor is at 5. Lawyer is at 2, Teacher at 3. Manager is not next to Teacher so must be at 1. Accountant must be at 5.

question: Six friends (A, B, C, D, E, F) from different countries sit in a circle facing the center. The Japanese person sits to the left of A. B is opposite the German. The French person sits next to the Japanese. C is neither German nor Japanese. E is Italian. D is not French. Who is Brazilian?
explanation: Japanese sits left of A. B is opposite the German. French next to Japanese. C is not German/Japanese. E is Italian. D is not French. By elimination, F must be Brazilian.

question: Seven professionals (P, Q, R, S, T, U, V) sit in a straight line. A lawyer sits at one end. An engineer is third from the other end. P is a teacher and sits next to the lawyer. R is a doctor and is next to the engineer. Q is a manager and sits to the left of P. U is neither a lawyer nor an accountant. V is at the right end. Who is the accountant?
explanation: Lawyer at one end, engineer third from other. P (teacher) next to lawyer. R (doctor) next to engineer. Q (manager) left of P. U not lawyer/accountant. V at right end. Therefore, S must be the accountant.

question: Five friends (A, B, C, D, E) from different countries (Japan, Italy, Brazil, India, Germany) are seated around a circular table facing the center. A is to the left of the Brazilian. B is opposite the German. C is not next to A. The Italian sits to the right of D. E is Indian. What is A's nationality?
explanation: E is Indian. B is opposite German. A is to the left of Brazilian. The Italian sits to the right of D. By elimination, A must be German.

question: Six professionals (Doctor, Engineer, Lawyer, Teacher, Manager, Accountant) sit in a linear row. The Engineer is at the left end. The Lawyer is 3rd from the right. The Doctor is next to the Teacher. The Manager is between the Accountant and the Lawyer. Who sits to the immediate right of the Doctor?
explanation: Engineer is at the left end and Lawyer is 3rd from right. Manager is between Accountant and Lawyer. Doctor is next to Teacher. Thus, the Teacher sits to the right of the Doctor.

question: Six friends – A, B, C, D, E, and F – are sitting around a circular table facing the center. A sits opposite D. B sits next to C and E. F is not next to A. Who sits opposite to B?
explanation: A sits opposite D. B sits next to C and E, leaving F. F cannot be next to A, therefore F sits opposite B.

question: Seven people - P, Q, R, S, T, U, V - are sitting in a straight line facing North. Q is to the immediate left of R. P is at one end. S is to the immediate right of T. V is at the other end. U is between P and Q. Who sits exactly in the middle?
explanation: Given constraints, the only arrangement places R in the middle position.

question: Five friends (A, B, C, D, E) from different countries - USA, China, Japan, Italy, Brazil - sit around a circular table facing the center. A is to the left of the American. The Chinese person sits opposite B. D is from Italy and sits next to E. E is not from the USA. The Japanese sits next to the American. Who is from Brazil?
explanation: D is Italian. A is to the left of American, so A is not American. Chinese is opposite B. E is next to D and not American. Japanese sits next to American. Therefore, C is Brazilian.

question: Six professionals (P, Q, R, S, T, U) – Doctor, Engineer, Lawyer, Teacher, Manager, Accountant – sit in a row facing North. The Engineer is 2nd from the left. P is at the right end and is a Teacher. The Doctor sits next to the Teacher. Q, the Manager, is to the left of R. S is the Accountant. T is the lawyer. Who is the Engineer?
explanation: Engineer is 2nd from left. P (Teacher) is at the right end. Doctor next to P. S (Accountant). T (Lawyer). Q is Manager and to the left of R. Hence, Q must be the Engineer.
